newsitem.title: USA: CSCE world sugar ends firmer, maintains range.
newsitem.headline: CSCE world sugar ends firmer, maintains range.

text.p: CSCE world sugar futures closed firmer and near the top of the day's range, buoyed by light speculative and trade buying, floor sources said.
Producer selling remained steady throughout the day, limiting gains in the most-active July contract to below resistance pegged at 10.92 cents per lb.
Support was cited at the day's low of 10.73 cents, followed by 10.65 cents, the low hit on May 2. Dealers said the speculators could begin liquidating long positions beneath this level.
Open interest in July stood at 73,479 lots, down 855 lots, as of early Wednesday.
Front-month July closed 0.08 cent firmer at 10.84 cents per lb, having ranged from 10.85 to 10.73 cents. The rest of the board settled 0.03 lower to 0.05 firmer.
Volume was estimated at 6,753 lots, compared with Wednesday's official 12,442 lots.
